TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CacheVirtualItemsEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CacheVirtualItems> event occurs when a new area of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> in virtual mode is exposed and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> determines a new range of items is needed.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this type. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CacheVirtualItems> event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.
To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of type <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> named `ListView1`. Then ensure that the event handler is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CacheVirtualItems> event.
[!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#465](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples/CS/EventExamples.cs#465)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#465](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples/VB/EventExamples.vb#465)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 startIndex, int32 endIndex) cil managed

Docs.param: The starting index of a range of items needed by the for the next event that occurs.
The ending index of a range of items needed by the for the next event that occurs.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified starting and ending indices.
Gets the ending index for the range of values needed by a control in virtual mode.
Docs.value: The index at the end of the range of values needed by the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The range of values specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CacheVirtualItemsEventArgs.StartIndex%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CacheVirtualItemsEventArgs.EndIndex%2A> properties represents the range of values most likely needed by a virtual <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control for the next occurrence of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.RetrieveVirtualItem> event.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CacheVirtualItems?displayProperty=fullName> event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A?displayProperty=fullName> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.
To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of type <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> named `ListView1`. Then ensure that the event handler is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CacheVirtualItems?displayProperty=fullName> event.
[!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#465](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples/CS/EventExamples.cs#465)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#465](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples/VB/EventExamples.vb#465)]

Docs.summary: Gets the starting index for a range of values needed by a control in virtual mode.
Docs.value: The index at the start of the range of values needed by the control.
